It's not often that I find a custom launcher out there on the market that I genuinely feel is worthy of my time. Well, this launcher is different from most others I have used. The lightweight feel of it, along with the minimalistic approach makes it practical for my tablet, and the true stock Android Pie feel makes my tablet feel much more authentic. Most custom launchers offer features which can only be accessed by a hefty puchase - well this app has no locked features. Overall, a great app!

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Check if there are any other third party launchers installed (except Nova). Anything based off of my work might be using a duplicate permission.

google_play_reviews.content: I have tried many launchers but never really liked any of them until I tried this! I am a huge fan of this launcher but I find it lacks some features. Otherwise, great launcher, I will be sticking with this for now.

google_play_reviews.content: Cleanest launcher from Play Store. I'm glad you make it up there, but there's a thing.. it asks for permissions to access all data and I didn't found any privacy statement to read.

TLDR: I only use permissions in my apps for necessary functionality. In my launcher that is, automatically installing my bridge. You can sideload the bridge from GitHub and deny the storage permission if you want.
